p: Multiple human-mediated environmental changes and activities have been found to be key drivers of zoonotic disease emergence, promoting the conditions in which zoonoses can emerge.4, 5, 25, 26 Such drivers include, for example, land-use change, intensive livestock production, wildlife trade, and anthropogenic climate change,5 all of which have been linked to multiple zoonotic disease outbreaks in humans (appendix pp 4–7).
